headline: Ask HN: Have dev training budget and some goals, recommended books/courses?
description:
I've been working with .NET desktop applications for the entirety of my career so far, and my current position is asking me to come up with training I'd like to spend some of our dev training budget on.

I'd like to start building much stronger backend and web development skills, I've done a few tiny toy projects with varying success (tiny frontend with Angular, unfinished larger frontend with React, tiny Web API with ASP.NET Core).

My manager agreed with that when we had our last 1:1 and also recommended learning C or C++ as well, since I'm self-taught and don't have that experience from college.

I believe we have access to the O'Reilly web collection, and I've already got a Pluralsight account through work, but my manager and director have talked about being open to other learning paths so long as they can be vetted. What are some recommendations the community might have based on my goals and known available resources?
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 有专门的培训预算和一些目标，推荐的书籍/课程？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 有專門的培訓預算和一些目標，推薦的書籍/課程？
description_zh-Hans:
到目前为止，我的整个职业生涯都在使用.NET桌面应用程序，而我目前的职位要求我拿出培训，我想把我们的开发培训预算的一部分花在上面。

我想开始建立更强大的后台和Web开发技能，我已经做了几个小小的玩具项目，取得了不同的成功（使用Angular的小前端，使用React的未完成的大前端，使用ASP.NET Core的小Web API）。 [...]
description_zh-Hant:
到目前為止，我的整個職業生涯都在使用.NET桌面應用程序，而我目前的職位要求我拿出培訓，我想把我們的開發培訓預算的一部分花在上面。

我想開始建立更強大的後臺和Web開發技能，我已經做了幾個小小的玩具項目，取得了不同的成功（使用Angular的小前端，使用React的未完成的大前端，使用ASP.NET Core的小Web API）。 [...]
